page.title: 15LIVERY STABLES
page.content: In our block there are a few{SMALL {HOLDINGS}which are now too small to be farmed economically and are used for other purposes. One such holding just inside our boundary is being used as{ {LIVERY STABLES}for horses. The 4.85 hectares of land are sown in grass and divided up into 5 fields and 2 paddocks. There are 13 stables and 13 horses and ponies, 3 of which are foals. When a horse or pony is stabled here, hay, straw and hard feed e.g. oats, barley, beetpulp etc. are provided. The horses and ponies are fed at 7am and 8pm in summer and 7am and 7pm in winter. Throughout the summer 6 horses are in at night and 7 out all the time. During the winter only one horse is out all the time. The rest are in and are only put out occasionally e.g. when the stable is being 'mucked out'.
